revised_title: Ariel 5 Hard X-Ray Observations: Exploring Galactic Sources and Spectra
tldr: This article discusses the hard X-ray observations made by the Ariel 5 satellite, focusing on various types of galactic sources and their spectral analysis. The study identifies at least three different classes of galactic sources, including magnetospheric-controlled sources, sources with power-law spectra, and white dwarf emitters. The findings provide insights into the physics of X-ray emission processes and help classify objects based on their emission mechanisms.
